entry.title: Autumn Activities That Will Leaf A Smile On Your Face

link.title: Autumn Activities That Will Leaf A Smile On Your Face

entry.content:
Oh my gourd, autumn is here! Beleaf me when I say this is going to be the best autumn ever! Don’t like autumn? Don’t be hay-tin on this season! Here are some things you can do in Toronto to get into the holiday (oops, too soon…) fall spirit!

  1. Autumn Treats!

Start with a warm drink, probably something from Tim’s (not sponsored, but they should consider it!). It doesn’t have to be a pumpkin spice latte (but it could). Hot chocolates and French vanillas are some solid options too! This season also gives us a lot of maple and caramel flavoured drinks. Maybe you’re more of an apple cider person? As for food, well, I love me some apple pie!

  1. Experience Nature!

Yes, everything is indeed dying. And yes, the wise birds are leaving before the disaster known as winter in Canada strikes. But that doesn’t mean we can’t enjoy the beauty of the season! Go for a hike on one of Toronto’s many trails, take in the view, get that Insta shot! #AutumnVibes

Alternatively, go apple picking or select the best pumpkin in the patch!

  • Sincerely,

The Pumpkin Patch Kids™

  1. Corn Mazes!

I’ve never done one myself but HOLY HECK does it look like a blast!!! If you’re looking for one, Downey’s Farm has an 8km corn maze! Hit me up if you’re down! ;)

  1. Halloween Events!

You might be feeling too old or if you’re like me (too lazy) to go trick or treating but don’t worry! There are plenty of other events that’ll send shivers down your spine. Get scared this season (and not just in an ‘I have 20 assignments and it’s 2am’ sort of way)!

There's Canada's Wonderland Halloween Haunt, Halloween on Church Street on the 31st, Screemers down at the CNE or one of several zombie walks and haunted houses. You could also catch a horror flick if you aren’t a total chicken like me…

  1. Cheer on the Raptors!

Minus Kawhi Leonard.

Additional Pro Tips!!!

•Catch the good times, not a cold!

•Crunch on some crrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrispy leaves!

•Stay cozy! Much love, MCI!
entry.summary: Oh my gourd, autumn is here! Beleaf me when I say this is going to be the best autumn ever! Don’t like autumn? Don’t be hay-tin on this season! Here are some things you can do in Toronto to get into the holiday (oops, too soon…) fall spirit!
